{{refimprove|date=April 2011}} {{Infobox sports season | title =2010â11 LEB Oro season | league =[[Liga EspaÃ±ola de Baloncesto#LEB Oro|LEB Oro]] | sport =[[Basketball]] | logo = | pixels = 200px | caption = | duration = | no_of_teams =18 | no_of_games =306 (regular season) | attendance = | TV =FEB TV, [[MARCA TV]] | season =Regular Season | season_champs =[[CB Murcia]][http://www.feb.es/NoticiaDesarrollo.aspx?idNoticia=37437 CB Murcia is crowned on gold in a magic night] FEB.es {{Es icon}} | MVP ={{flagicon|ESP}} [[Ricardo GuillÃ©n]][http://www.feb.es/NoticiaDesarrollo.aspx?idNoticia=37643 The MVPs of the season in Adecco Oro] FEB.es | MVP_link = | top_scorer ={{flagicon|ESP}} [[Ricardo GuillÃ©n]] | top_scorer_link = | playoffs = Playoffs | playoffs_link = 2011 LEB Oro Playoffs | conf1 = Playoffs | conf1_link = | conf1_champ = | conf1_runner-up = | conf2 = | conf2_link = | conf2_champ = | conf2-runner-up = | finals = Copa PrÃ­ncipe | finals_link = 2010â2011 LEB Oro season#Copa PrÃ­ncipe | finals_champ = [[Obradoiro CAB]] | finals_runner-up = [[CB Murcia]] | finals_MVP = {{flagicon|ESP}} [[Alberto Corbacho]] | finals_MVP_link = Copa PrÃ­ncipe de Asturias de Baloncesto | seasonslist = | seasonslistnames = LEB Oro | prevseason_link = | prevseason_year = [[2009â2010 LEB season|2009â10]] | nextseason_link = | nextseason_year = [[2011â2012 LEB Oro season|2011â12]] }} The '''2010-11 LEB Oro season''' is the 15th season of the [[Liga EspaÃ±ola de Baloncesto]]. It's named too '''Adecco Oro''' by sponsorship reasons. The 306-game regular season (34 games for each of the 18 teams) began on Friday, October 1, 2010, and will end on Friday, April 15, 2011. The champion of the regular season will be promoted to [[Liga ACB]]. The teams between 2nd and 9th position will play a best of 5 games play off, where the winner will be promoted too to the higher division. The teams 16th and 17th will play a best of 5 games play-out where the loser will be relegated to LEB Plata, with the 18th team. ==Competition format== ===Eligibility of players=== All teams must have in their roster: *A minimum of six eligible players with the Spanish national team. *A maximum of two non-EU players. *A maximum of three EU players, which one can be a player from an [[ACP countries|ACP country]]. *If a team has not two non-EU players, it can sign a player of everywhere. Teams can not sign any player after February 28. ===Regular season=== Each team of every division has to play with all the other teams of its division twice, once at home and the other at the opponent's stadium. This means that in ''Liga LEB'' the league ends after every team plays 34 games. Like many other leagues in continental Europe, the ''Liga LEB'' takes a winter break once each team has played half its schedule. One feature of the league that may be unusual to North American observers is that the two halves of the season are played in the same orderâthat is, the order of each team's first-half fixtures is repeated in the second half of the season, with the only difference being the arenas used. This procedure is typical in Europe; it is also used by [[La Liga]] in [[football (soccer)|football]]. If two or more teams have got the same number of winning games, the criteria of tie-breaking are these: #Head-to-head winning games. #Head-to-head points difference. #Total points difference. At the final of the season: *The regular season winner promotes directly to [[Liga ACB]]. *Teams qualified between 2nd and 9th, will join the promotion play-offs to ACB. *Teams qualified in 16th and 17th will play a relegation play-out to LEB Plata. *Team qualified in 18th position is relegated directly to LEB Plata. == Team information == [[CB Murcia]] and [[Obradoiro CAB|Xacobeo Blu:sens]] were directly relegated from [[Liga ACB|ACB]] after finishing in the bottom two places and they will substitute [[Basket Zaragoza 2002|CAI Zaragoza]] (champion) and [[Menorca BÃ squet|ViveMenorca]]. [[CB CornellÃ ]] and [[Ciudad de Vigo BÃ¡squet]] left the league after finishing in 17th and 18th position. Also, CB CornellÃ  lost the play-out with [[CB Tarragona|CB Tarragona 2017]]. [[CDB Amistad y Deporte|FundaciÃ³n Adepal AlcÃ¡zar]] as champion of LEB Plata and [[CB PeÃ±as Huesca|Lobe Huesca]] as LEB Plata play-off winner will enjoy the league. [[Tenerife Baloncesto]] renounced because of a future fusion with [[CB 1939 Canarias]] and [[CB MallorquÃ­|BÃ squet Mallorca]] will play LEB Plata after the [[Spanish Basketball Federation]] didn't accept their request. |- |} *''UB La Palma with one point deducted.'' ==Copa PrÃ­ncipe== At the half of the league, the two first teams in the table play the [[Copa PrÃ­ncipe de Asturias de Baloncesto|Copa PrÃ­ncipe de Asturias]] at home of the winner of the first half season (17th round). The Champion of this Cup will play the play-offs as first qualified if it finishes the league between the 2nd and the 5th qualified. The Copa PrÃ­ncipe will be played on January 30, 2011. ===Teams qualified=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Team!!Position!!Date of qualification secured!!Participation |- |align="left"|[[Obradoiro CAB|Blu:sens MonbÃºs]]||1st||22 December 2010||1st |- |align="left"|[[CB Murcia]]||2nd||29 December 2010||3rd |} ===Copa PrÃ­ncipe Final=== {{Basketballbox | bg = #eee | date = 30 Jan 2011 | time = 19:00 [[Central European Time|CET]] | report = [http://competiciones.feb.es/estadisticas/Partido.aspx?p=818128 Stats] | teamA = [[Obradoiro CAB|Blu:sens MonbÃºs]] | scoreA = '''81''' | scoreB= 78 | teamB = [[CB Murcia]] | overtime = | Q1 = 27-27 | Q2 = 16-19 | Q3 = 18-16 | Q4 = 20-16 | points1 = Alberto Corbacho, 21 | rebounds1 = Miquel Feliu and [[Michael Ruffin]], 5 | assist1 = [[AndrÃ©s RodrÃ­guez (basketball)|AndrÃ©s RodrÃ­guez]], 5 | otherstat1 = '''Eff:''' Alberto Corbacho, 21 | points2 = [[Vitor Faverani]], 13 | rebounds2 = Juan Ignacio Jasen, 5 | assist2 = Roberto Morentin and Pedro Rivero, 4 | otherstat2 = '''Eff:''' [[Taylor Coppenrath]] and [[Vitor Faverani]], 12 | place = [[PabellÃ³n Multiusos Fontes Do Sar|Fontes do Sar]], [[Santiago de Compostela]] | attendance = 5,100 | referee = Morales, Carpallo, Bravo | series = Blu:sens MonbÃºs, champion of the Copa PrÃ­ncipe de Asturias[http://www.feb.es/NoticiaDesarrollo.aspx?idNoticia=36498 Blu:sens shines to win the Cup] FEB.es {{Es icon}} }} ==Playoffs== ===Promotion playoffs=== {{Main|2011 LEB Oro Playoffs}} Teams qualified from 2nd to 9th will play the promotion play-off. If the winner of [[Copa PrÃ­ncipe de Asturias de Baloncesto|Copa PrÃ­ncipe]] is qualified between 2nd and 5th at the final of the Regular Season, it will join the play-offs as 2nd qualified.
